channel.title: Psiphon (Homemade Proxy)
channel.description:
Come try my proxy out. It is different then most proxies in that it is secure, and requires a username and password to login with. Because of this you can make the login page blend in with some random site, say a history site. So that when a teacher comes a walking by it looks like your working on a history project. Anyways, I haven't gone that far yet, but try it out anyways.
https://216.234.127.84/Onaway/login/
Username: Onaway
Password: ohs
Once logged on just type in the URL of where you want to go.
Post feedback here, try different sites and let me know if it works.

item.title: Psiphon (Homemade Proxy)
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“sup000, post:2, topic:236647”]congrats

[code]216.234.127.84 uses an invalid security certificate.

The certificate is not trusted because it is self signed.
The certificate is only valid for onawayschool.no-ip.org.

(Error code: sec_error_ca_cert_invalid[/code][/quote]

That dosen’t mean anything other than what it says, the cert is self-signed and not issued by a trusted root provider. If you don’t understand what something means perhaps not bitching at the OP would be a good idea.

Read full topic

Why is that way not good for high traffic?

item.title: Psiphon (Homemade Proxy)
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:10, topic:236647”]Here is a proxy I made which takes 5 secs. Just put it on your web server, and it lets you browse pages.
[php]

<?php $page = $_POST['page']; $handle = fopen($page, "r"); $contents = stream_get_contents($handle); echo $contents; fclose($handle); ?>

[/php]

Page: [/quote]Obv not good for high traffic.

Read full topic

item.title: Psiphon (Homemade Proxy)
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

I have a PHPproxy also.

I made this one for me and some friends of mine to get on myspace at school with.

Actually, I didn’t “make” it. I setit up, whoever said it is a Glype Proxy is right.

Glype normally won’t be blocked by a school administrator because they are oblivious to what it is. They just blacklist every site with the word proxy in it, so keep that word off your site and your good.

Read full topic
